name: Shoreham

reviews.text: Perfect spot....just down the block from the Peninsula and around the corner from Trump Tower. Was in town for the Cotto-Judah fight at MSG and to get a clean room from 299 just off 5th Avenue is a deal. Was even lucky enough to get street parking just outside the hotel for my rental because I got back from MSG late. Rooms are small but shower looked brand new and nice LG flat screen. Can't see why anyone would flame this joint.....
reviews.title: Cool, hip spot.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my boyfriend visited NYC in April and I had spent hours researching hotels to stay in after hearing that expensive and tiny rooms were common in the city. I chose The Shoreham, as for a central boutique hotel it seemed like a good value deal, and I got a great deal with a small London-based independent travel agency, much better prices than the website or expedia. My tip is to search around for web prices, they are drastically different!
reviews.title: Was a great central hotel!

likes.disliked: — View of a brick wall from window!

reviews.text: Once we'd arived at the hotel, we were given our room by helpful and friendly staff (I'd read they were very unhelpful). We had the lowest priced double, but it was not as small as I'd imagined and had a large double, very comfy bed, huge flat screen TV and en-suite with huge and very powerful shower. Very simple but stylish and had everything we needed for a city break and base.
reviews.title: Tremendously improved!

likes.disliked: — small bathroom, windows with no views

reviews.text: Also, we really liked the bar, which was small but perfectly formed with gorgeous cocktails. We didn't try the food but the bar menu seemed nice too.
reviews.title: Good value and great location

reviews.text: When we left we had an evening flight and were worried about leaving our luggage but the staff obviously get this a lot and have a designated room that you can leave your luggage in for no extra cost.
reviews.title: great location and good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After checking that hotels in NY were very expensive and most of them are deteriorated by the use, we were very careful to choose the perfect one.
reviews.title: I would repeat it!!!

reviews.text: After staying 5 night in The Shoreham, we are very happy for the chosen one. At the first sight, you can't imagine how good it is because the entrance is not very spectacular. Nevertheless as you are entering the hotel, the atmosphere is very modern, not as many hotels in NY.
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience!

likes.liked: — Luxury king bed with pillow top and down comforter

reviews.title: Cooked alive!
reviews.text: The room was as modern as the entrance. The furniture was very smart and there was a huge plasma screen TV hung up in the wall. The staff was very friendly, not as it is supposed in NY. And the rooms, as they're not huge, are fine.

If that's not enough, there are 2 things that I haven't seen in many hotels. Near the hall, there are 2 computers in which you can surf in Internet free!!! That's awesome if you are far away from home. And the second one is that there's a free coffee machine you can have free coffees and hot chocolates. And they are quite good.
reviews.title: Great Hotel In Mid Town

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to every people who wants to stay in NY. For me it was perfect.
reviews.title: Overall a good hotel
Comfort,value and a few extras
reviews.text: Our daughter goes to school in New York so whenever we go to visit we check out different hotels, hoping to find that perfect spot.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This time we stayed at the Shoreham, whose location on 55th between 5th and 6th is close enough to be able to run in Central Park, and is just down the street from the posher St. Regis and Peninsula.
reviews.title: Average stay at Shoreham - unhelpful concierge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall it was a good experience. Front desk staff were efficient and welcoming and our rooms (we treated our daughter to a break from dorm life) were clean and comfortable. Our executive King even came with a terrace - too bad the weather was freezing! Our winter special rate included a buffet breakfast with lots of delicious fresh fruit, granola and pastries. The Aveda bath products were very pleasant - there was face and body cleanser as well as the usual shampoo, conditioner and moisturizer. Free internet access and a large flat screen TV were much appreciated.
reviews.title: Shoreham staff great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely recommend the Shoreham for budget minded travellers who enjoy a touch of luxury.
reviews.title: Great location
Not a good experience
reviews.text: This hotel is average, there are definitely better hotels in NYC for the same price. Very small room with worn carpet. Flat screen TV was nice. Rooms need to be freshened up. Concierge said he would be glad to provide any assistance needed, then when we called and asked him to make us a dinner reservation he said he would and then never called back. Make sure you get free breakfast included in your rate. Good location.

While we initially had some trouble with the check-in process and some quips with the front staff, the hotel was overall very nice. We booked our trip through TravelZoo at $199/night rate for the weekend and also stayed our 1st night through their MOMA package. While we were supposed to get early 12PM check-in with the MOMA package, we were told at 2:45 when we arrived, that our room was not ready. As far as the early check-in, I was told, "We have no record of that. Your room is not available." After coming back after 3PM, it appeared the initial front staff person had no clue what she was doing while the other people in the front staff did.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in convienient location
Great location, cool style hotel
reviews.text: Our room was the standard queen room. It was very clean and an okay size for NYC standards. The bathroom had a pretty large shower which they could have probably made smaller and made the rest of the bathroom bigger. The bed was very comfortable. The room was extremely quiet although part of that had to do with the fact that we were on the 9th floor not facing the street. The room had a mounted plasma. The only complaint was that the A/C was very cold and the vents pointed at the bed. Since the room is smallish, it would tend to get stuffy if the air wasn't on, but when the air was on, it was freezing cold. Keeping the fan on (without the A/C) helped with the problem but then made the room somewhat noisy.

We got free continental breakfast one morning with our MOMA package which was very nice. However, we discovered on check-out that we got charged for the breakfast. The front-desk was polite and took off the charges.
reviews.title: Very positive experience

likes.liked: — Location, quality and comfort of the accomodations, price
likes.disliked: — Small size of room, no view

reviews.text: The hotel is located just off of 5th ave next to all of the fancy shops. It is 1/2 block from a subway station (F line) or about 2 1/2 blocks from 2 other subway stations with more line choices. It's also close to a small supermarket and drug store.
reviews.title: small room,great location

reviews.text: For $199/night, this was definitely worth it.
reviews.title: Thoroughly recommended!

aka: The Shoreham Hotel New York City
description: SHOREHAM is a fashionable retreat dedicated to the experience of design. Flat-screen monitors throughout the property feature an array of video and interactive art with vibrant images of nature in motion. The hotel offers a variety of accommodations ranging from superior to specialty suites available with king, queen or two queen-sized beds. Signature amenities include invigorating five-head hydro-massage showers in junior suites and select rooms, iJoy massage chairs, Bose Wave® radio CD players, Wi-Fi and flat-screen TVs. Guest room baths are appointed with high-gloss white marble tile, gray slate vanity tops, brushed stainless steel sinks with satin nickel fixtures and Aveda bath amenities. Guests are treated to a champagne toast upon arrival. SHOREHAM is perfectly positioned just steps away from the top shops of Fifth Avenue, Central Park, Broadway and more!
